physical_appearance: This cotton stole is predominantly dark green in colour. There is a silver-coloured border along the perimeter of the rectangular stole. Within the border, there are medallion-shaped patterns running vertically from the top to the bottom of the stole. And within each medallion, there is a calligraphic writing in script language.
sgcool_label_text: This cotton stole from the Rajasthan region is embellished with block-printing done in silver. The surface of the stole has a repeated medallion, within which appears the word “Allah” in Nastaliq calligraphy. The narrow border shows a flower vine pattern.
subject_terms_1: textiles (visual works) Islam medallions (ornament areas) nasta?liq  running ornament
subject_terms_2: Textiles Stoles (Clothing) Shawls God (Islam) Motifs Calligraphy, Persian
techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique) weaving calligraphy (process) block printing (relief printing process)
